question_text:
Question 51 
 
A pump draws water 
3
(density
1000kg.m )


 at a steady rate of 
1
10 kg.s .

 The pressures at the suction
and discharge sides of the pump are −20 kPa (gauge) and 350 kPa (gauge), respectively. The pipe 
diameters at the suction and discharge side are 70 mm and 50 mm, respectively. The suction and discharge 
lines are at the same elevation, and the pump operates at an efficiency of 80 %. Neglecting frictional losses 
in the system, the power (in kW) required to drive the pump is ______ (rounded off to two decimal places).
[Fluid Mechanics, 2 Marks]
